page.title: 01FAIR OAK CHURCH
page.content: FAIR OAK{INDEPENDENT METHODIST CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1874. THIS CHURCH IS SERVED BY AN UNPAID MINISTRY AND IS SELF GOVERNING AND SELF SUPPORTING. BUILT OF BRICK AND TILE IT IS HALF PANELLED IN OAK AND THE PEWS WERE ALL MADE FROM THE SAME TREE. THE MEMBERSHIP IS OF NECESSITY SMALL BUT ATTENDENCE EQUALS THAT OF THE ANGLICAN CHURCH USUALLY. ON THE FIRST SATURDAY IN MAY EACH YEAR FOR NEARLY 100 YEARS THE MAY QUEEN IS CROWNED ON THE VILLAGE GREEN. FOLLOWING THIS THE CHILDREN ARE TAKEN AROUND THE VILLAGE ON A WAGON AND THEN TO TEA AT THE CHURCH FOLLOWED BY GAMES.
